args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a more specific subtype or member of the category denoted by the object within a taxonomic hierarchy.
args.justification: All five relations express the same subtype/instance-to-category taxonomic link (e.g., specific facial expressions or gestures as members of a broader category). To ensure schema consistency, they should share a unified canonical description and a single, coherent relation class. The last two were previously placed in rel_cls_group=IDENTITY despite clearly being hierarchical, so their group is corrected to HIERARCHY and all are normalized to the same taxonomic_hierarchy_relation class.
